attributes.action: legislate to take tougher action on fraud and advise the public on how to protect themselves against internet fraud and misappropriation of data
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
AOL today reports,

"UK credit card and debit card fraud on the internet is much greater than previous estimates, new findings suggest. Bank industry figures published earlier this year show "card not present" losses for internet, phone and mail order crime were £290.5 million last year.

But a BBC News investigation found that £500 million of fraud took place when failed attempts were taken into account.

Posing as computer hackers, two BBC News journalists infiltrated a website selling thousands of card details which had been stolen online from small internet retailers.

The petitioner is calling on the P.M. to explain how is this possible ? legal ? unprosecutable ? What can we do about it ?

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
